chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: But 6 Minute English isn't just about vocabulary. We improve your listening skills as well. So why not turn on the audio subtitles or download the script to read along as you listen. It could also help you answer my question.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: I am going to say Japan.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: I think the really exciting thing is that even 10 years ago we would have thought yes it's all to do with ourselves.Now we understand this relationship between what we call cell and society and we really can make a difference and in fact a recent paper just came out which said that 60% of our aging can be controlled by how we live.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: So what lifestyle should we choose?Here's Sarah Harper giving more details to BBC Radio 4 program Inside Health.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: One important factor in aging well is a positive attitude, feeling hopeful, confident and focused on the good things in life.This conclusion was based on several twin studies, scientific research which uses twins to study the roles of genetics and environment in human development.In studies Professor Harper found positive twins stayed healthier than negative twins as they aged.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: Here Professor Sarah Harper explains how in countries like Spain, Italy and Greece regular social interaction helps people age well.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: The healthy food such as fresh vegetables and fish eaten by people living in countries around the Mediterranean Sea is known as the Mediterranean diet.Mediterranean cultures have other advantages too including outdoor exercise which is easier in warm climates and communal meals a case study.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: Mediterranean people are also more likely to live in multi-generational households where people from two or more generations of a family live together in the same house.Not everyone can live in the Mediterranean but it seems a positive attitude and social interaction are two things we can all do to age well.Speaking of which what was the answer to your question Phil?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: Ok well I asked you about the oldest living person ever recorded.I asked what country they came from and you said Japan.Well I can reveal the answer is actually France.A lady in France lived for 122 years and 164 days.And if you knew the answer to that there are other questions about this program in the quiz on our worksheet which you can find on our website bbclearningenglish.com
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: Let's recap the new vocabulary we've learnt about staying young at heart, an idiom which means to think and behave in a youthful way in spite of growing older.People with a positive attitude feel hopeful, confident and focused on the good things in life.Twin studies use twins to investigate the roles of genetics and environment in human development.A Mediterranean diet describes the foods typically eaten by people living in countries around the Mediterranean Sea.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: Including fresh vegetables, olive oil and fish.At a communal meal people sit down together to talk and share food.And finally a multi-generational household is when people from two or more generations of the same family live together.Once again our six minutes are up but if you enjoyed this discussion then head over to the BBC Learning English website to find the accompanying worksheet and quiz.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_The secrets to a healthy old age.json

chunks.chunk_text: Along with loads of other programs and resources to help you learn English.See you there!Bye!
